snippet: Campaign for One New York, a lobbying organization set up by the mayor’s campaign strategists, got donations from unions, developers and people like Google’s Eric Schmidt.
abstract: Records filed with New York State show Campaign for One New York, lobbying group set up by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's campaign strategists, spent close to $1.7 million in first half of 2014 to promote his agenda and accomplishments.
lead_paragraph: Campaign for One New York, a lobbying organization set up by the mayor’s campaign strategists, got donations from unions, developers and people like Google’s Eric Schmidt.

headline.main: Group Aiding de Blasio Spent $1.7 Million in First Half of ’14
headline.print_headline: Group Aiding de Blasio Spent $1.7 Million in First Half of ’14
